Params: {3: 'A gentle breeze brushes his face, bringing the scent of fresh grass.'}
{3: 'A small hand places a bouquet in front of a tombstone.'}
{2: 'Shin', 3: "You're on your own now. Are you afraid?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Shin', 3: 'Then let me walk with you for a little bit longer.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Shin takes the small hand and heads outside the cemetery.'}
{3: 'They walk past his childhood home, familiar streets, and every inch of land they have trodden.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'The boy grows, shedding his childishness and becoming a young man.'}
{3: "Shin raises his hand to pat Watanabe's head like before, but he places it on Watanabe's shoulder instead, patting it gently."}
{2: 'Shin', 3: "Go on. Don't be afraid of the future. Have hope. Be excited.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'With a gentle push, he sends Watanabe into the desert.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Watanabe', 3: 'If I had gone that day, Bruce...', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Coates', 3: 'Then those guarding the surface would have lost another leader.', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Backhaus', 3: 'I told you not to come early, kid!', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bruce', 3: 'Do you remember what we talked about before, Watanabe?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bruce', 3: "I'm not going to die, I'm going so that fewer people die.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bruce', 3: "You don't need to feel regretful about the past anymore. You've protected more people and taught many to protect themselves and others.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bruce', 3: "You've fulfilled your promise to become the blade that cuts through the night.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The phantoms from the past gradually fade away, turning into falling snow.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Cyril', 3: "You've never forgotten the ground beneath your feet, even when you turned your gaze toward the sky.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Cyril', 3: 'Perhaps that was why I lost to you.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Cyril', 3: 'Tell me, do people still remember our battle?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Watanabe', 3: 'Yes. Not just me, but everyone fighting for the future remembers.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Felix', 3: 'My brother and I never regretted following you, Boss.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Philip', 3: "Don't grieve for those you couldn't save. Focus on the living.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Finally, he stands before the sandstorm named "death."'}
{3: 'Watanabe hears a voice that has almost faded from his memories.'}
{3: 'The voice of the person who gave him life speaking at the moment of his birth.'}
{2: 'Tsuru', 3: 'Keep going. I believe my child will walk his own path.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'He walks into the sandstorm without hesitation...', 4: '1'}
{3: "Watanabe's artificial heart beats again. Having expected another fight, Watanabe is surprised by what he sees."}
{3: 'Ballard lifts the collapsed debris, creating a small, secured space.'}
{3: "Steel beams have pierced his body, his vital fluid splattering onto Watanabe's face along with sparks."}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: "Hah, I guess luck is on your side today... Or maybe that's just my karma."}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: 'Because one of us has to live...'}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: 'Someone always has to die, just as someone always has to live.'}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: "I realized it the moment the Longinus Arsenal didn't fire that one, and only one of us had to live."}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: 'If we both died, the Forsaken would lose their direction and fall into chaos without a target for their vengeance.'}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: 'The pain, regret, silence, and bloodshed of those warriors would then be all for naught.'}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: "Hmph. You're wondering why we can't both live, aren't you?"}
{3: 'Life continues to slip away, as well as the repressed feelings he has accumulated all these years.'}
{3: 'Ballard seems to have returned to the era back when he was called "Uncle Ballard".'}
{3: 'Now, it is time to give Watanabe one last lesson.'}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: 'I lost control of the situation when I had to use your death to stir up their hatred.'}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: "It proved that I couldn't rally the Forsaken the way you did and that the conflict between Forsaken and Babylonia hadn't reached the point of no return."}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: "Even if I revealed our advantages and our real history, they wouldn't have followed me, nor would they have let the war start."}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: 'Now, news of your return has spread, and I have lost to you.'}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: 'How could the flame of hatred continue after being doused by rain?'}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: "If you were the one who lost today, I could've treated your death as the truth and continued my plan."}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: 'This was a duel where only one could survive. The victor decides the future, and the loser is swept into the dustbin of history, edited and glossed over.'}
{2: 'Watanabe', 3: "Why can't it be the way before?"}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: "Because I've stepped into the spotlight, revealing not my identity, but my purpose."}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: "I won't change my mind. As long as Babylonia remains away from the surface in its safe haven, humanity will never unite."}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: "The Punishing Virus didn't destroy us. It was the Great Evacuation that broke the spine of this era in two."}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: 'The connected parts were severed, one flying to the sky while the other falling onto the ground.'}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: 'But the distance between the sky and the ground is so far away... How can a spine this broken support the weight of an era?'}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: 'Those cowards who call themselves the "World Government" are no longer our comrades.'}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: "They wouldn't have suppressed the once-honorable Constructs otherwise. They need warriors, but they fear them at the same time."}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: 'You want me to be a coward like them?'}
{3: 'He shouts, his anger no less intense than the sparks flying from his pierced chest.'}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: 'Rememberâ€”never pity your enemies, regardless of the past and the relationship you share.'}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: 'If the situation were reversed, I would end you without hesitation.'}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: "If there's only one thing worth sacrificing everything for..."}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: "It's what you stand for. The line you don't cross."}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: 'What do you believe in? What do you stand for? Who do you fight for?!'}
{2: 'Watanabe', 3: '...The comrades who stand with me, and this land we refuse to abandon.'}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: 'Will you eliminate any threats in its way, including your own sentiments if necessary?'}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: 'Do you still think I can live now?'}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: "Don't worry about the missiles launching after I'm gone. I removed the connection before you arrived..."}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: 'Accept the gift of the old era.'}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: "I didn't expect to die the same way I escaped... Is this my punishment?"}
{3: 'Even the light in his chest dims.'}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: 'Can you be the spine that carries the weight?'}
{3: 'With a hint of worry, his eyes gradually close.'}
{3: 'He seems to hear the sound of rockets soaring through the sky, people cheering, annoying advertisements, and the pattering of rain.'}
{2: '????', 3: "I said, aren't you a little bit late?"}
{1: '1', 2: 'Backhaus', 3: "Isn't it tiring to live this long?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Ballard', 3: 'It was tiring, but it was worth it...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The sound of rain replaces his silence.'}
{2: 'Backhaus', 3: "There are probably some faces you don't wish to see because of what you did, so I have to be the one to come get you.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Backhaus', 3: "Let's go. Time to hit the road.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'He prepares to follow Backhaus into the rainy depths.'}
{3: 'He reveals a pack of rather luxurious cigars in his hand.'}
{2: 'Backhaus', 3: 'For the bet I lost last time.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'As he touches the cigar, Ballard seems to hear the answer to his last question.'}
{1: "The spine that carries the weight won't be me...", 3: '55', 6: '1'}
{3: "The spine that carries the weight won't be me..."}
{2: 'Backhaus', 3: 'The kid is someone we can count on, right?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'He lights the cigar, confirming that no one familiar has followed him...'}
{3: 'And he walks toward his tomb without looking back.'}
{3: 'The clouds have parted. The rain has stopped.'}
